{"step_by_step_thinking": "The rigidity observed in the body of the deceased is a post-mortem change known as rigor mortis. This happens due to the cessation of cellular respiration, which leads to a depletion of ATP in the muscle cells. ATP is required for the relaxation of muscle fibers after contraction. In the absence of ATP, the actin and myosin filaments within the muscle fibers remain locked in a contracted state, leading to muscle stiffness or rigor mortis.
